A suggestion regarding data sharing: [REDACTED] sharing in an RDM context means publishing your data on a trusted data repository like for example the KU [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] (https://rdr.kuleuven.be/). [REDACTED] institutional repository helps KU [REDACTED] researchers to publish, share, cite and preserve their data in a findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable way with support from KU [REDACTED] staff. [REDACTED] data are safely preserved on KU [REDACTED] servers, receive a DOI and are automatically linked with [REDACTED] [REDACTED] is also possible to put pseudonymized data in restricted access. [REDACTED] someone requests access to the data, you can evaluate the request and then a data sharing agreement will be drawn up together with the KU [REDACTED] RDR team and legal team in order to protect the data. [REDACTED] information: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr/custom-kuleuven
